intro: Silene dissecta, commonly known as the dissected catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to magenta flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often finely toothed. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Silene dissecta is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is typically short-lived, completing its life cycle within one growing season.
